materials.raw_text: 7 g of Arsenic (As), 9 g of Cobalt (Co), 2 g of Sodium (Na), 3 g of Ruthenium (Ru)

sourcing.instructions: Arsenic can be sourced from chemical supply companies or specialized metal suppliers. Cobalt is available at metal suppliers or online marketplaces. Sodium can be obtained from chemical suppliers, while Ruthenium is available from metal or precious metal suppliers. Ensure all materials are handled with appropriate safety precautions.
steps: Arsenic can be sourced from chemical supply companies or specialized metal suppliers. Cobalt is available at metal suppliers or online marketplaces. Sodium can be obtained from chemical suppliers, while Ruthenium is available from metal or precious metal suppliers. Ensure all materials are handled with appropriate safety precautions.

1. Weigh each ingredient (As, Co, Na, Ru) using a precise scale. 2. In a clean, dry mixing container, combine the weighed amounts: 7 g of As, 9 g of Co, 2 g of Na, and 3 g of Ru. 3. Stir the mixture thoroughly with a non-reactive stirrer for at least 5 minutes to ensure uniform distribution. 4. Transfer the mixture into a crucible suitable for high-temperature reactions.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh each ingredient (As, Co, Na, Ru) using a precise scale. 2. In a clean, dry mixing container, combine the weighed amounts: 7 g of As, 9 g of Co, 2 g of Na, and 3 g of Ru. 3. Stir the mixture thoroughly with a non-reactive stirrer for at least 5 minutes to ensure uniform distribution. 4. Transfer the mixture into a crucible suitable for high-temperature reactions.

steps: 1. Preheat a furnace to 1200 °C (2192 °F). 2. Place the crucible containing the mixture into the furnace. 3. Maintain the temperature for a duration of 2 hours to ensure complete melting and homogeneity of the material.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a furnace to 1200 °C (2192 °F). 2. Place the crucible containing the mixture into the furnace. 3. Maintain the temperature for a duration of 2 hours to ensure complete melting and homogeneity of the material.

steps: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (about 25 °C or 77 °F). 2. Do not open the furnace until it has cooled completely to avoid thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (about 25 °C or 77 °F). 2. Do not open the furnace until it has cooled completely to avoid thermal shock.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond-tipped saw to cut the solid into the desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 3. Sand the edges and surfaces with fine-grit sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to enhance durability.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond-tipped saw to cut the solid into the desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 3. Sand the edges and surfaces with fine-grit sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to enhance durability.
